page.title: 11North Newington Village (1)
page.content: North Newington is a very old place. It is built round a valley. It's {population is 250}. Its oldest and largest house is called {Grafton House} It was built in 1620. Grafton was also built in 1620. Grafton cottage is the {Post Office}. It was built in 1750. There are {107 buildings} in North Newington. Only eight of them are thatched. Most of the houses are built out of {Hornton Stone} which is a brown and beige colour. There are two Public Houses. Although the village is only small, it has its own Primary School called Bishop Carpenter School. There is a {blacksmith} in the village which is a rare thing these days. The village {Chapel} was built in 1876 but it is now disused. Very few houses are built of brick.
